Simon Cowell was always the one people cared about, because he was the hardest one to get. , 22:16 EST Google announced Thursday that co-founder Larry Page would replace Eric Schmidt as chief executive of the Internet giant in April. Google said Eric Schmidt would remain with the company as executive chairman and focus on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships. The firm's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , will work on strategic projects and new products, Google said in a statement. Quotes delayed, except where indicated otherwise. Delay times are 15 mins

Bill Bartmann said he doesn't believe a Eric Schmidt appointment would resonate with voters or significantly help the John McCain House's struggle to combat high unemployment. Instead, he suggested someone with more entrepreneurial experience who gets what it's like for the little guy, pointing to Fred Smith, the founder and CEO of FedEx( FDX) and a supporter of John McCain 's 2008 presidential bid. administration official Ralph Benko. "Seize this moment, Mike Pence ," Jim Ryun , along with conservative leaders L. Brent Bozell, Dick Armey and Morton Blackwell , wrote in a letter they sent to Mike Pence on Thursday. Now is the time for you, as one of this generation's leaders, to take your rightful place in the pantheon of American leadership, to cast aside personal considerations, and defend this God-blessed nation that has given us, and the world, so much. Mike Pence has said he is considering whether or not to pursue a presidential run and that he plans to make a decision by the end of January.
